sentence: Global IT services provider, Accenture plcACN , recently announced the acquisition of Tquila UK - one of the leading independent consulting services providers of salesforce.com Inc. CRM in Europe.
However, the financial terms of the transaction have not been disclosed.
The recent move is expected to be part of Accenture's strategy of strengthening its position across Europe as a provider of Salesforce services and cloud implementations.
Founded in 2010 and based in London, Tquila is one of the largest independent partners of Salesforce in Europe which specializes in delivering cloud solutions powered by the Salesforce1 platform.
The company currently has over 100 dedicated Salesforce professionals.
Post acquisition, Tquila will become part of Accenture's Emerging Platforms business under the Accenture Technology segment.

Moreover, by integrating Tquila's dedicated Salesforce professionals, Accenture will become one of the largest Salesforce service providers in the United Kingdom with approximately 185 skilled consultants.

With this acquisition, Accenture will be better positioned to leverage the latest technology for its clients, provide enhanced performance and strengthen its position as a global leader in Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) based applications as well as Salesforce services.
The acquisition will also help Accenture to improve its customer relationships and expand market share by solving business critical issues.

Notably, Accenture is already a global leader in providing Salesforce implementation services and currently has over 5,000 skilled Salesforce consultants of which more than 1,900 are certified consultants.
Moreover, as Salesforce is one of the largest providers of cloud-based applications and software, it becomes necessary for Accenture to enhance its capabilities in delivering Salesforce's services.
Over the past couple of years, the demand for cloud-based software and applications is on the rise.

According to Centaur Partners, the SaaS and cloud-based business applications are likely to grow from $13.5 billion in 2013 to $32.8 billion in 2016, reflecting a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 19.5%.
Moreover, Computerworld forecasts that 42% of IT decision makers are planning to increase spending on cloud computing in 2015.
The exponential growth in the amount of data, complexity of data formats and the need to scale resources at regular intervals compelled several companies to turn to cloud computing vendors.
Therefore, considering the growing need for cloud-based applications and software, we expect Accenture's investments in this space to boost long-term growth.
Accenture resorts to strategic acquisitions to diversify its offerings and expand operating markets.
A strong cash balance ($4.06 billion) and operating cash flow ($301 million in second-quarter fiscal 2015) enable it to pursue frequent acquisitions.
Last month, Accenture acquired Axia Limited which provides strategic consulting services and implementation support to help clients manage costs, and gain a competitive advantage.
Its consulting services address a number of areas including growth, operational excellence, go-to-market models, performance management and M&A strategies.
The Axia buyout will help Accenture expand its presence in the strategy consulting market with the potential to boost its market share.
In March this year, Accenture acquired analytics services and solutions provider - Gapso - which focuses on analytical planning systems to solve complex logistics and manufacturing challenges.
The buyout is expected to strengthen Accenture's position as a leading analytics solution provider and enable it to deliver products and services quickly and in a cost efficient manner.
We are encouraged by Accenture's strategy of growing through acquisitions.
However, we remain slightly cautious due to its modest third-quarter fiscal 2015 outlook.
Also, increasing competition from Cognizant Technology Solutions Corp. CTSH and a sluggish economic recovery may dampen growth.
Accenture carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
A better-ranked stock in the technology sector is Cirrus Logic Inc. CRUS , sporting a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).
